title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top NFL Draft prospect, is excited about potential Tom Brady mentorship if drafted by the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, a star quarterback at Indiana, won the Heisman Trophy, College Football Playoff National Championship, and several MVP awards.
Despite being the likely No. 1 pick, Mendoza remains humble, expressing gratitude to any NFL team that drafts him.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' starring Jennifer Lopez is streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' documentary is available on Prime Video.
'Bridgerton' Season 4 (Part 2) is now streaming on Netflix.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a Red Sox spring training game against the Braves, but remained in the game.
Both players received medical attention and continued to play, with Anthony hitting a single and Rafaela a home run.
The collision, attributed to a communication error, resulted in minor injuries with Anthony bruising his arm and Rafaela straining his hamstring.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund once a player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's donation continues his tradition of supporting the Jimmy Fund, aimed at cancer care and research at Dana-Farber.
Last season, only two Red Sox players hit 20 homers: Trevor Story and Wilyer Abreu.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: New Hampshire House advanced the CHARLIE Act, restricting teachings on race, history, and LGBTQ+ in public schools.
House Bill 1792 passed 184-164, chiefly along party lines; only four Republicans opposed with all Democrats.
Violations could lead to teacher discipline or legal action, permitting lawsuits of up to $10,000 per offense.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are dyed with food coloring, a tradition spanning decades.
Hairpin Turn on the Mohawk Trail provides views of the Hoosac Valley and is a known scenic spot.
The Golden Eagle Restaurant sits on the Hairpin Turn, rebuilt in 1958 after two truck crashes.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts reports first two measles cases of 2026, involving a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The Boston adult recently traveled abroad with uncertain vaccination history and potentially exposed others to measles.
The U.S. faces a large measles outbreak with 1,136 cases in 2026; Mass. health officials emphasize vaccination.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, a lifelong resident of South Boston, died on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness.
Morgan was known for her work with the City of Boston Inspectional Services and her appearance in a Dunkin' Donuts commercial.
She is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and a large extended family and friends.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor her late father.
Her father passed away from ALS, a disease that impacts families by stealing independence, dignity, and time.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness and hope for better ALS treatments by participating in the marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion after AG Andrea Campbell moved to strike her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio's lawsuit seeks to enforce a ballot measure authorizing legislative audits, opposed by Speaker Mariano and Senate President Spilka.
Campbell argues the lawsuit lacks authority without her office's approval, framing her role as gatekeeper of legal disputes.
